Based on the given preferences, I recommend "Inglourious Basterds". This movie is set in Nazi Germany during World War II and follows a group of Jewish American soldiers who are part of an operation called The Basterds.

The movie stars Brad Pitt as Col. Hans Schneider, the leader of the Basterds, and Chris Hemsworth as Private Nathan Ricker.

The plot revolves around the plan by the Basterds to assassinate Adolf Hitler and other Nazi leaders by staging a series of surprise attacks using planes, tanks, and even submarines.

However, due to unforeseen circumstances and betrayal by some members of their own group, the plan ultimately fails and several lives are lost.

Despite the failure of their plan, the Basterds still manage to escape from Nazi Germany and continue their fight against racism and oppression.

Overall, "Inglourious Basterds" is a well-made movie that tells an inspiring story about perseverance, resilience, and determination in the face of adversity.
